intro: Myosotis davurica, commonly known as the Siberian forget-me-not, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It is characterized by its delicate blue or purple flowers and heart-shaped leaves. The plant typically grows in alpine and subalpine environments, thriving in cool, moist conditions. Myosotis davurica is part of the Boraginaceae family, which is known for its medicinal and ornamental plants. Its flowers bloom in early summer, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies.
